instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.SMC_LID_RIGHT: What is SMC_LID_RIGHT? SMC_LID_RIGHT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the right LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed â€“ if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_RIGHT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .

threads.message: When you lower the Mac's screen and lift it up, it shows no image.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> When it goes to sleep, the LCD is off.
threads.message:
Check security settings and allow machine tyo boot from USB.
Then see what happens booting known good USB macOS.
Is good to discard a software issue.

Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_RIGHT</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>LEFT_R</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signals; when screen goes off.
Do PRAM reset, just in case.
